title: Skill Sync responsive multi-page UI with auth, credits, feedback, and dark mode (frontend-only)

requirements.summary: Create a responsive app shell with a modern navbar (logo, primary nav, login/logout) present on all pages.
acceptanceCriteria: Navbar renders on all pages and collapses appropriately on mobile (e.g., hamburger menu).
Logo text reads “Skill Sync” and is consistently styled.
Navigation highlights the active page and routes work without full page reloads.

file_operations.description: Create the root app component that wires client-side routing for Home, Skill Match, Dashboard, Login, Signup (profile setup), and Live Class pages within a shared app shell layout.
Implement the shared layout wrapper (background, navbar slot, footer slot, main content container) used by all routes. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Build a responsive navbar with the Skill Sync logo, nav links (Home, Skill Match, Dashboard) using active highlighting, and Login/Logout entry points; use shadcn-ui primitives (e.g., Button, Sheet/DropdownMenu) for mobile collapse and menus. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a small navbar-ready control that shows Login when unauthenticated and a user menu + Logout when authenticated; integrate with the existing Internet Identity hook and clear cached queries on logout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a Login page that triggers Internet Identity login and provides a clear path back to the app after success (e.g., redirect to intended route).

requirements.summary: Implement the Home page sections (hero, CTAs, features, how-it-works, testimonials, footer) with responsive layout and routing CTAs.
acceptanceCriteria: All listed Home sections are present, visually distinct, and responsive.
CTA buttons are clickable and route users to appropriate pages (e.g., Skill Match for learning and Dashboard for teaching) or prompt login if required.
Footer includes at least: an email contact, and 2–3 social link placeholders.

file_operations.description: Create the Home page with hero heading/subheading, two CTAs, features grid (Live Classes, Credit System, Smart Matching, Doubt Solving), 3-step How It Works with icons, testimonials, and a footer section; use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button, Card) for card-based sections. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a reusable features grid that references the generated icon sprite for feature visuals and uses consistent card styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a 3-step How It Works section with icon + title + description rows/cards, designed responsively. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a footer component with contact email and 2–3 social link placeholders, styled consistently across themes.
Add the generated logo asset to be used in the navbar and/or Home hero (static public asset).
Add the generated abstract gradient background asset to be used for the global app shell background (static public asset).
Add the generated 4-icon sprite asset to be referenced by the Home Features and How It Works sections (static public asset).

requirements.summary: Create Login + first-time Signup (profile setup) UI using Internet Identity and profile creation/saving in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: Login button triggers Internet Identity authentication and results in an authenticated session in the UI.
Signup screen is reachable for first-time users and allows saving a basic profile (name + skills).
Authenticated state is reflected in the navbar (e.g., shows user menu and Logout).

file_operations.description: Add React Query hooks to load the current user's profile from the backend interface and to create/save the profile; follow the selected authorization component guidance to avoid first-time profile setup UI flash. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement the first-time profile setup page shown after successful Internet Identity login when no profile exists; collect name and skills and call the backend interface to create/save profile; use shadcn-ui form primitives (e.g., Input, Button, Badge) for a polished UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a route guard wrapper that redirects unauthenticated users to the Login page and supports returning to the originally requested route after login.
Create a wrapper that, once authenticated, ensures a user profile exists; if not, routes to the profile setup (Signup) flow.
Wire Login and Signup (profile setup) routes, and apply auth/profile guards to post-login sections (e.g., Dashboard, Live Class) while keeping public pages (Home, Skill Match) accessible.

requirements.summary: Create a post-login Dashboard showing profile (name/skills/credits), booking CTA, upcoming sessions list, earned credits, and feedback star summary.
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard requires login; unauthenticated users are redirected to Login.
Profile shows name, a skills list/chips, and a numeric credits balance.
Upcoming sessions list renders with at least: skill/topic, partner name (or placeholder), date/time, and status.
Feedback ratings are displayed as star visuals (1–5) with an average rating.

file_operations.description: Implement the Dashboard page using the current profile hook for Name/Skills/Credits, show a Book a Session CTA, render an upcoming sessions list (using stored local placeholder session data when backend session listing is not available), and compute/display a feedback ratings summary from profile feedback; use shadcn-ui components (Card, Button, Badge) for the card-based layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable 1–5 star visual component usable in read-only (average) and interactive (select rating) modes for Dashboard and Live Class. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a small local persistence hook (e.g., localStorage keyed by principal) to track upcoming session entries created from the Skill Match booking action and shown in the Dashboard.
Register the Dashboard route and wrap it with RequireAuth and RequireProfile so it is only accessible when logged in and the profile exists.

requirements.summary: Create the Skill Match page with search, categories, match cards (rating, credit cost), and a booking action that respects auth state.
acceptanceCriteria: Search filters match cards by name/skill text (client-side is acceptable).
Category selection filters the visible match cards.
Each match card displays: user/mentor name placeholder, skill(s), star rating, and a credit cost value.
Clicking “Book/Request Session” prompts login if not authenticated, otherwise leads to a booking flow or creates an upcoming session entry.

file_operations.description: Implement Skill Match page UI with a search bar, category filter chips (Coding, Design, Music, Language), and match cards showing placeholder mentor/user, skills, star rating, and credit cost; booking action should prompt login when unauthenticated and otherwise create a local upcoming session entry and optionally start a backend session then navigate to Live Class. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable match card component that displays name placeholder, skills, rating stars, and credit cost, plus a Book/Request action button; built with shadcn-ui Card/Button. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register the Skill Match route and ensure navbar navigation points to it.

requirements.summary: Create the Live Class page UI with video placeholder, timer, feedback submission, and credits calculation display tied to duration and rating.
acceptanceCriteria: Live class page shows a clearly labeled video placeholder region (no real video integration required).
Timer can be started/stopped for a session and displays elapsed time in a readable format.
Feedback form allows selecting 1–5 stars and entering a comment; submission persists to backend for the session.
Credit calculation display updates based on timer duration and selected rating and shows the resulting credits earned/spent.

file_operations.description: Build the Live Class page with a labeled video placeholder region, a start/stop timer, a feedback form (star rating + comment), and a credits calculation panel that updates as duration/rating changes; on submit, call the backend interface to submit feedback for the active sessionId and refresh relevant cached profile data. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a timer hook that supports start/stop/reset and exposes formatted elapsed time for the Live Class UI.
Implement a deterministic frontend credit calculation helper based on duration and rating for display purposes (must return the same result for the same inputs).
Register the Live Class route and protect it with RequireAuth (and RequireProfile) so only authenticated users can access it.

requirements.summary: Apply clean, youth-focused visual design with gradient background, card-based layout, modern typography, and smooth hover/transition animations.
acceptanceCriteria: All primary surfaces use a consistent card style (spacing, radius, shadow) and look cohesive across pages.
Gradient background is present and does not reduce text readability (adequate contrast).
Interactive components (buttons/cards/nav links) have visible hover/focus states and smooth transitions.
Layout is responsive and usable on mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints.

file_operations.description: Create the missing src-level CSS entry imported by main.tsx; compose Tailwind base and include project-wide utility classes for gradient background overlays, consistent card surfaces, and transitions (while keeping text readable).
Adjust global CSS variables and base styling as needed to support the blue+purple youth-focused theme across light/dark modes, while preserving the existing Tailwind/shadcn token approach.

Apply the soft gradient background (including the generated background image at frontend/public/assets/generated/skillsync-bg.dim_1920x1080.png) and consistent card-based layout spacing across all pages.

Ensure nav items/buttons include clear hover/focus states and smooth transitions, and that the layout remains responsive across breakpoints; use shadcn-ui components where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add dark mode with a navbar theme toggle that persists preference and updates gradients/background and surface colors.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme toggle is accessible from the navbar (or equivalent global location).
Theme choice persists across refreshes (e.g., local storage) and applies on initial load.
Dark mode maintains readability and consistent styling for cards, text, and controls.

file_operations.description: Implement a lightweight theme manager that toggles the document class (dark/light) and persists the preference in localStorage; initialize theme on app load before rendering theme-sensitive UI.

Create a theme toggle control for the navbar (e.g., icon button) wired to the theme hook; use shadcn-ui Button/DropdownMenu styling conventions if applicable. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add the theme toggle to the navbar in a globally discoverable location and ensure it works in both desktop and mobile navbar variants.
Update light/dark token values and any background/overlay styling so the gradient/background and card colors adapt correctly while maintaining contrast and readability.
